meanings.definition: To protect too much or excessively.
meanings.sent1: She always overprotects her little brother, never letting him play outside alone.
meanings.sent2: The mother overprotects her child by constantly monitoring their every move.
meanings.sent3: The helicopter parent overprotects their child, even when they are just playing in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The security guard overprotects the building, making sure no one enters without permission.
meanings.sent5: The guard dog overprotects its territory, barking at anyone who comes near.

meanings.sent1: He overprotects his belongings, always keeping them locked away.
meanings.sent2: The teacher overprotects her students, never allowing them to take risks.
meanings.sent3: The knight overprotects the princess, guarding her day and night.
meanings.sent4: The software overprotects the files, making it difficult to access them.
meanings.sent5: The farmer overprotects his crops, using scarecrows to keep birds away.
